alert.note: Alert for Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 11:27AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN LAWRENCE...SOUTHEASTERN CABELL...KANAWHA...NORTHWESTERN MINGO...CENTRAL PUTNAM...LINCOLN... SOUTHERN ROANE...NORTHWESTERN LOGAN...NORTHWESTERN CLAY... SOUTHEASTERN JACKSON...SOUTHERN WAYNE AND NORTHERN BOONE COUNTIES... At 1126 AM EDT, a snow squall was located over Hurricane, or 7 miles southwest of Winfield, moving east at 35 mph. Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this squall. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Madison, Winfield, Logan, Hamlin, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Chapmanville, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, Poca and East Bank. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 39. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 128. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 34 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 83 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 17 and 80. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location.
